name: Marcus Rivera

deep_desires.reason: Teaching salary isn't enough for growing family
Wants skills that won't be automated away
Craves problem-solving that uses his analytical mind
Tired of being undervalued as 'just a teacher'
Wants to model reinvention and growth

major_obstacles.description: Overwhelmed by endless course options and doesn't know which path to take
Full-time job + family = only 1-2 hours/day for learning
Can't afford expensive bootcamps or quit job to learn
Gets stuck completing courses but can't build real projects
Worried about competing with younger developers
Learning alone without peers or mentors who understand

internal_voice: Am I too old to start over?
I don't have time to waste on the wrong path
I can't afford to fail - I have a family
Maybe I should have done this 10 years ago
Am I being irresponsible chasing this dream?
searching_for: A proven, linear roadmap - Clear steps from beginner to hired developer
Time-efficient learning - Maximum progress in minimal available time
Real-world relevance - Skills that actually matter for getting hired
Community of peers - Other career changers who understand his situation
Mentorship from success stories - Proof that the transition is actually possible
Validation of experience - How his teaching skills transfer to tech

emotional_landscape.urgency: Time pressure to make this career change work before it's too late
emotional_landscape.overwhelm: Too many choices, not enough clear guidance on the right path
emotional_landscape.guilt: Time away from family vs. investing in their future
emotional_landscape.fear: Of failure, of wasting time, of not being good enough
emotional_landscape.determination: Willing to sacrifice short-term comfort for long-term gain
emotional_landscape.isolation: Learning alone without peers or mentors to guide him

learning_journey.name: Inspiration Phase
learning_journey.description: Sees coding success stories, gets excited about possibilities

learning_journey.name: Overwhelm Phase
learning_journey.description: Discovers hundreds of courses, doesn't know where to start

learning_journey.name: Tutorial Hell
learning_journey.description: Completes FreeCodeCamp, Codecademy but can't build anything real

learning_journey.name: Confidence Crisis
learning_journey.description: Doubts his abilities, compares himself to younger learners

learning_journey.name: Seeking Guidance
learning_journey.description: Desperately looking for clear roadmap and mentorship

video_tone: Speak to him as a professional peer, not a beginner
Acknowledge the real challenges and time constraints
Show respect for his current career experience
content_themes: How teaching skills transfer to coding
video_formats: What to learn vs. what to skip
avoid: Don't treat all learners the same
